abstract: Jose Antonio Rodriguez Salas, mayor of Jun, Spain, says using Twitter has saved his town money and democratized communication between citizens and local government; more than half town's 3,500 residents have Twitter accounts, which they use regularly to make healthcare appointments, report suspicious activity, complain about utilities or keep tabs on officials.

headline.print_headline: The Spanish Town That Runs on Twitter
headline.main: The Spanish Town That Runs on Twitter

snippet: Jun, on the outskirts of Granada and with a population of 3,500, has turned to the social network to help the town provide many public services.
lead_paragraph: Jun, on the outskirts of Granada and with a population of 3,500, has turned to the social network to help the town provide many public services.
